=== About Ubuntu Ohio ===

Ubuntu Ohio is a group of enthusiastic people dedicated to spreading Ubuntu in the great state of Ohio, the 7th most populous state in the United States. We are known as a LoCo Team, which stands for a Local Community of Ubuntu users. We often get together at conventions, meetings, parties, and online.

For more information about us check out our home page <nowiki>[[http://ohio.ubuntu-us.org/|here]]</nowiki>, and our Launchpad group <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-us-ohio|here]]</nowiki>. Our Mailing List archives can be found <nowiki>[[https://lists.launchpad.net/ubuntu-us-ohio/|here]]</nowiki>.

=== R Cycle Goals ===

 {*} Local Global Jam and Release Party events

 {*} Increased Transparency in the Team and leadership

        - Bi-weekly Ubuntu Hours with several ReLoCos, taking the opportunity to use Ubuntu in public
          and possibly recruit new users.

=== Online Activities ===

 {*} <nowiki>[[http://ohio.ubuntu-us.org/planet|Planet Ohio]]</nowiki> -- LoCo blog showcase

 {*} #ubuntu-us-oh IRC channel on Freenode

 {*} Steady Mailing List activity.

 {*} <nowiki>[[http://ohio.ubuntu-us.org/burningcircle|Burning Circle]]</nowiki> podcast named in honor of the Cuyahoga River that caught fire in the 1970's.  The current intent behind the production is to provide a means for airing reports from ReLoCo leads.

=== Events in the last year ===

 {*} Restored original 3-person council governance model

 {*} See a full list of events at <nowiki>[[http://ohio.ubuntu-us.org/calendar|Google Calendar]]</nowiki>

     - These take place in four different cities. Cleveland, Cincinnati, Columbus, and Akron. In the state of Ohio, there is a LoCo event every week.
